intro: Tephrosia carvalhoi, commonly known as the Carvalho's tephrosia, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically features small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or white, often accompanied by trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
